intro: Costus zamoranus, commonly known as the Zamora costus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric, and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers with a distinctive, aromatic scent. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties. Costus zamoranus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
